description:
Resample a label file to a different mesh.

Resamples a label file, given two spherical surfaces that are in register.  If ADAP_BARY_AREA is used, exactly one of -area-surfs or -area-metrics must be specified.

The ADAP_BARY_AREA method is recommended for label data, because it should be better at resolving vertices that are near multiple labels, or in case of downsampling.  Midthickness surfaces are recommended for the vertex areas for most data.

The -largest option results in nearest vertex behavior when used with BARYCENTRIC, as it uses the value of the source vertex that has the largest weight.

When -largest is not specified, the vertex weights are summed according to which label they correspond to, and the label with the largest sum is used.

The <method> argument must be one of the following:

ADAP_BARY_AREA
BARYCENTRIC

current_sphere.title: current_sphere
current_sphere.description: a sphere surface with the mesh that the label file is currently on

new_sphere.title: new_sphere
new_sphere.description: a sphere surface that is in register with <current-sphere> and has the desired output mesh

current_area.title: current_area
current_area.description: a relevant anatomical surface with <current-sphere> mesh

new_area.title: new_area
new_area.description: a relevant anatomical surface with <new-sphere> mesh

anyOf.description: specify surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

area_surfs.description: specify surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

current_area.title: current_area
current_area.description: a metric file with vertex areas for <current-sphere> mesh

new_area.title: new_area
new_area.description: a metric file with vertex areas for <new-sphere> mesh

anyOf.description: specify vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

area_metrics.description: specify vertex area metrics to do area correction based on

opt_current_roi_roi_metric.title: opt_current_roi_roi_metric
opt_current_roi_roi_metric.description: use an input roi on the current mesh to exclude non-data vertices: the roi, as a metric file

opt_valid_roi_out_roi_out.title: opt_valid_roi_out_roi_out
opt_valid_roi_out_roi_out.description: output the ROI of vertices that got data from valid source vertices: the output roi as a metric

opt_largest.title: opt_largest
opt_largest.description: use only the label of the vertex with the largest weight

opt_bypass_sphere_check.title: opt_bypass_sphere_check
opt_bypass_sphere_check.description: ADVANCED: allow the current and new 'spheres' to have arbitrary shape as long as they follow the same contour
